intro: Stellera velutina, commonly known as the velvetleaf stellera, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves that give it a distinctive velvety texture. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Stellera velutina is often found in the understory of forests, where it forms dense colonies.
